thread_text:
" Check if you need to fill out Form W-9 to keep your Gigs active. You got 30 days to check."

the_mad_duck

thread_name: Is the W-9 popup permanently stuck on my screen?
frequent_posters: the_mad_duck, misscrystal, vickiespencer, hazel_justin131, seoalamin10x, freelanceplus1, imagination7413, mariashtelle1, janali
thread_text:

reply_text:
the_mad_duck:
Is this going to stay on my screen for an entire 30 days?
Mine went away the day after I filled out the form.
the_mad_duck:
I do not make enough to fall into the category of sellers that need to fill out a W-9 form.
Regardless, every Us citizen must fill out the W9. Please read this notice by Fiverr. The first FAQ explains it.
https://sellers.fiverr.com/en/article/w-9-collection
the_mad_duck:
Will my gigs be locked if I don’t complete it,
This is what the thread said
W-9 US Verification Requirement
Please note that all sellers are required to check if they need to fill out a Form W-9, regardless of their place of residence. By not doing so, within 30 days, your Gigs will be subject to automatic deactivation.
the_mad_duck:
even though I don’t make enough to matter?
It does not matter if you do not make $20,000. The W9 must be filled out. Fiverr will send 1099 to the relevant tax authority only if you make $20,000.
W-9 US Verification Requirement
When Fiverr is required under applicable laws, it will send a 1099 form at the end of the year to the applicable tax authorities. Currently, this applies to US-based sellers who earned at least $20,000 in that year and had at least 200 separate orders.
the_mad_duck:
Check if you need to fill out Form W-9 to keep your Gigs active.
The only users who do not need to do this are non-US citizens.

thread_name: Problem with display of package options
thread_text: Tried to create a gig recently but noticed a strange problem where some options that I selected when I set it up aren’t displayed on the gig page. For example even though I selected amount of pages for each tier and also “responsive design” and “content upload”, you can only see check mark for “include source code” on all 3 packages. Screenshots included for clarification.
reply_text: If it’s like that after saving it (eg. save and preview) and it’s not showing still not showing it properly after you view it normally you could create a support ticket about it with screenshots so they can fix it if it’s a bug.

reply_text:
From 2 sales in March and 3 sales in April to 0 since this bug occurred.
I know that the current situation in the world might cause that but I can’t understand why did I stop receiving any message? In March and April combined I received around 40-50 messages and, as I said, since this problem started I haven’t got a single message.
And when I search my gig sometimes it’s on the last page and other times I can not even find it.
Spamming “thank you” in every topic about this bug won’t help anyone.
We have to make Fiverr the best place for freelancers together and pointing out to the issues is one step closer to that goal.
Please don’t unpin this topic as you did with the last one.
We need everyone’s voice to be heard!
@wp_kid

reply_text:
There is no such thing as “rank” in the search results. Your gigs are not “ranked” on the last page. That’s just where you see them showing up right now.
If you want more orders, perhaps now is a good time to learn how to market and promote your services, on your own, to the target customers who need your services. Fiverr does not guarantee sales just because you have gigs on Fiverr, and they don’t guarantee that a seller’s gigs will show up in the search results where they/you want them to show up.
It is unwise to expect Fiverr to bring you all your sales, or to make you successful. That’s your job, and yes, it will require marketing, promotion, and not sitting back and waiting for things to happen. If things aren’t working out the way you want them to, try different things. Experiment until you find something that achieves the results you seek.

reply_text:
If the numbers were there in the place (eg. place in the database) the website code is using/used to retrieve them the values would show on the analytics page. But they don’t/didn’t. Before they changed the website code to show “N/A” for everything, the most recent few days were showing 0 for everyone. So the most recent days totals were getting either stored as 0 or null or not being stored at all in the place in the db the analytics page looks (reads) to show them, and still are likely not (otherwise they’d have removed the code that shows “N/A” in every field). So I don’t really think it’s just a “display issue”. ie. the more recent figures are wrong somewhere in the database (even if they’re right/stored in some other place).
So I’d say the correct daily totals for clicks etc. can’t be stored in the database currently for the days since it went wrong (started showing 0 for everyone). But it’s possible that there’s another table/file where the values needed to create those daily totals and that that is working okay (though it’s strange that it’s not been fixed so far).

bodmas:
Please @jonbaas if you know you are not affected by this, just stop posting same thing on every topic about “Nothing wrong with algorithm” you are not part of support team or Fiverr staff…
I am affected by this – and have been many times over the past few years. This is nothing new, and it does not stop a good seller from being successful. I have learned how to work withing the system, and I have learned how to overcome the obstacles. I am trying to help other people think for themselves, and learn to overcome these obstacles as well.
Just because the loud voices, that like to complain, don’t want to listen, doesn’t make me wrong, or the facts untrue. This is nothing new. The algorithm is working, and it is normal for gigs to rotate – and yes, move to the last page from time to time. This has happened to me half a dozen times or more over the past few years, and my gigs have always rotated back over time.
Be patient, learn to adapt, and please stop complaining as if this is the end of the world. It isn’t.
Wisdom comes from listening and learning. Be wise and listen.

Regarding This issue got answer from fiverr CS … Hope will be helpfull for everybody.
We’re working on getting your Gigs’ impressions, clicks, and views back online. No worries - your Gigs are active, and all the metrics are calculated as usual.
Dan | Team Lead (Fiverr Customer Support)
May 14, 2020, 3:30:19 AM EDT
Hello there,
Thank you for reaching out. We’re currently experiencing a display issue with gig impressions, views and clicks. The numbers are still being calculated properly, and we’re working to resolve this issue. This is happening for all sellers on Fiverr.
Currently there is no estimated time of the resolution but rest assured that it’s in our best interest to resolve this as quickly as possible.
Thank you for your patience and understanding.

reply_text:
Hi all! As you all I am facing the same issue. My gig was on the first page and now I can’t even find it in first 10 pages. No new clients no new messages. Then I messaged fiverr team and they told me my gig is totally fine. So I was really confused by not knowing what actually happened. Then I thought I should act positively.
If fiverr says they are working on it, surely they will be doing so. We have nothing to do with that. I don’t remember they waited us this much in the past few years. They might be facing some practical issues in this pandemic. That might be the reason for taking it this longer.
So these are the things I did
I update all my gigs again. Then I found out some gigs have lack of keywords and some have unwanted and wrong keywords
And I saw that fiverr has given a new place to put your “SEO TITLE”. Some of you might know about this already. If not, please go and update your SEO TITLE today.
Then I update the FAQ for many of my gigs. I hope it might help your client to understand your service much better.
Here is the most important thing. I saw my gig description works fine on desktop but not on mobile devices. Some of my gigs didn’t have spaces between paragraphs when it comes to mobile view. But it was totally fine in desktop view. We all know now everybody uses mobile. So this will have a real effect in your gigs.
Also, I take few fiverr tests related to my service. So I could verify few of my skills
And one last thing I did was, I spent a few bucks on “Learn from fiverr” tutorials related to my service to upgrade my skills. I must say these tutorials are Amazing. Specially tutorials from Mr. Daniel Walter Scott was excellent. I invite you to watch these tutorials and you will thank me one day. Also, you will get few badges at the end as a bonus and they will be displayed on your profile forever.
So these are the things I did in this bad situation. Because I thought doing something is better than waiting. Let’s hope for the best

reply_text:
baleksandar:
no one explained what was happening
You reminded me of my own experience. I sent a support ticket about this and I got an info that they will respond to my support ticket in around 24-48 hours. After 48 hours, I got a reply and… It was an automated message that told me that they will get back to me in around 10 days! Included their usual message: don’t worry. Your Gig is active if your Gig’s status is active.
I know right now the situation is not good. But, it’s not good for us, sellers. Affect our income and finances. I’ve tried some tips on this forum (another thread): changed the tags, changed the category, etc. Nothing works.

reply_text:
sameed_webdev:
It’s working for you Great. Isn’t working for many of Us That’s it.
I experience the same things all the loud voices are complaining about right now. I am not immune just because I am a Fiverr veteran. The search algorithm affects us all equally. The difference is, I work with the system, instead of complaining when it doesn’t do what I want or make me more visible than someone else. There are thousands of people who want to be on the first page of search results, but there isn’t room for them on that page. This is why the system rotates all gigs (based upon internal factors we do not need to know about).
If you are rotated “to the last page”, be patient, and you will likely be rotated back. This has happened to me many times over the past few years. Yes, it happens to me, and no, I am not complaining about it over and over here on the forums – like the current loud voices are.
This is how the search algorithm works.
sameed_webdev:
We aren’t getting any response from Buyers .
It is a terribly irresponsible concept to expect the Fiverr search system to work in your favor, and provide you with all of your orders. If you aren’t getting the kind of orders you want from the search system, then please take responsibility for your own success, and market and promote your gigs to your target customers – on your own – wherever they may be located. All businesses have to do this. Here on Fiverr, you are a businessman too, so I don’t understand why hard self-motivated work doesn’t apply to the loud voices here, on the forums?
Fiverr says the search system is working like it should. This clarification is clearly posted on everyone’s Gigs page. As Fiverr clearly states, the analytics display error has nothing to do with gigs being active, and functioning properly, within the search system.
sameed_webdev:
Kindly Take into consideration what others are going through.
I am well aware of the nature of the complaints being voiced here. Complaints, however, do not equal truth, especially when Fiverr has clearly spelled out the nature of the error (and it’s connection to anything else). Complaining about something that Fiverr says is not broken, is not going to result in the search system being changed to adhere to the demands being voiced here.
Please be patient. The analytics DISPLAY ERROR will be fixed when Fiverr fixes it.

reply_text:
vidvox:
more than 100+ Peoples Complaining on forum that There gig is not appearing on search
Please share your source for this number of people complaining. I’ve been around, here on the forums for years, and it doesn’t look like any more people now, than those who are usually complaining about this sort of thing in the past. The issue is a DISPLAY error. It has nothing to do with a gig’s ability to perform. As Fiverr states – clearly – on everyone’s Gigs page, all gigs are still gaining analytics, those analytics just aren’t being DISPLAYED. Gigs and the algorithm are working just fine.
vidvox:
Because Like me Many Other Peoples Follow Gig Analytics Page Because its Really Helps us a lot to check How Our Gigs are performing.
I don’t know. It sounds, to me, like many sellers are addicted to seeing stats, and they have come to believe that the stats guarantee them success. The analytics stats are just numbers. Success does not depend upon those numbers. Success depends upon the ACTIONS sellers take, and, as far as I’ve seen, most of the sellers complaining about the display error, are also the same sellers that aren’t taking any productive ACTIONS to become successful.
Analytics stats will not guarantee success. Sitting around and watching numbers rise and fall won’t result in profitable gigs. Stop staring at the numbers, and start doing research, promotion, marketing, experimentation, taking risks, etc.
You don’t to know your on-site impressions in order to build your business.

reply_text:
celebrawitch:
I am losing a lot of money!
Actually, you can’t lose something you never had. It is a false presumption that you can lose money that you have not yet earned. You are not losing money, you are losing time by complaining about something here, on the forums, that has no connection to how your gig performs in the search results. Perhaps your focus should, instead, be on developing a better gig that can more easily be connected to the needs of your target customers. You have every capability to earn sales, regardless of this analytics display issue.

reply_text:
I am not asking about any guarantee to Rank up my gig on First page I am not asking about orders and I am not Asking anything from you or fiverr to help me to grow my business. I am on fiverr from 2 years.
Like Me Many Users, I also Used analytics page to See their progress and That’s How we see our gig performance and that’s how we Speed up our Marketing and sharing policies in order to gain good impressions and Get some Good Response From Buyer.
My Question is Very Simple . Like You and 2 Other Persons in this forum , You are Saying Stats are Useless and This is Just a Display Issue . I Mean If Stats Are Working then why Fiverr Taking so much time to Resolve a display Issue? Even a Person who build website for 50$ knows how to Resolve Display issues and Fiverrr a millionaire Company Does not know how to resolve display issue???
Surely its not a display issue its more than this that’s why a millionaire company is struggling from weeks to sort out. Our Demand is Simple Fiverr Has Given us a Option to Keep track of our gigs performance ad activity and Previously with that it was working fine. Now If That option is hurting many sellers like me its our Right to ask fiverr to resolve this issue. My argument is not with you and I Have not started this with you. But Your Opinion is wrong that its just a display issue.
Lastly Fiverr is Open for all its not mine or yours only property to work with. We work with sellers Give them Revisions and After a bunch of Hard work we get only 4$ , on the other hand without too much work fiverr take 3$ from per order . So If you calculate this , it will come up as a million dollar daily fiverr gets. So then They should show some maturity , Have capacity of bearing New Customers and They should be able to sort out Bugs like this.
These all are my opinion and way of thinking. If You and any person don’t like I am sorry and Please accept my apologize in advance. Thank you

vidvox:
But Your Opinion is wrong that its just a display issue.
I am not wrong, because I am expressing the exact comments Fiverr themselves have stated. misscrystal:
Is there some sure way to make them go back up after they go down?
misscrystal:
What kind of control did you have when you could see those stats that affected them and improved them?
Well, as you know, none of us have control over impressions, so, in all honesty, there’s nothing any of us can do to make them go up again. reply_text:
wolfhowler:
I think people are obsessed with their stats.
I think there’s a big difference between being ‘obsessed’ with stats, and ‘interested’ in stats, yet a lot of the responses I’ve read on this thread suggest that even having a passing interest in stats is foolish and a waste of time. I simply can’t wrap my head around that way of thinking.
Do you need stats to sell? No, of course not. Just like you don’t need money to be happy. But it helps, right? Stats help you to make decisions about your business based on actual metrics, as opposed to speculation.
The metrics in Fiverr are woefully bad as-is. I’d love to know what keywords drove buyers to our gigs. I’d love to know which demos buyers listened to - how many times on average a buyer visited our gig before buying etc etc… All of these are metrics we could be shown, whilst still maintaining buyer privacy, and they would give us actionable insight to make changes to our gigs with.
The fact that Fiverr can’t even give us the absolute basic stats, for almost a month now, is the reason why people, myself included, get frustrated.

wolfhowler:
Well you say why can’t Fiverr trust all sellers.
With respect, you’ve paraphrased me a little there. What I said was that most of us will do the right thing, and for those who don’t, punishments exist to discourage bad behaviour, and I was referring only to being able to see some basic metrics related only to our own gigs, not giving out my username and password to random strangers, which is why I said we’re not quite comparing the same thing.
For clarity, my two pence on this is that Fiverr could and should give us more, higher quality metrics to work with. As Fiverr grows and evolves as a business (now an NYSE listed company, not some tin-pot freelance site), and as we all grow as sellers, why can’t we understand a little more about customer behaviour behind the scenes, when it’s related to our own gigs? That’s evolution. Exploitation will always happen, that’s what sensible risk-mitigation, rules and punishments exist for.
That’s my opinion, nothing more, and I totally get and respect that a number of people disagree with me.

reply_text:
wolfhowler:
I’m not saying this is the right thing to do, I do agree statistics are important to help improve marketing and understand business needs. But possibly Fiverr has a different goal.
Absolutely agree with you. But something that I feel often gets missed in conversations, is that Fiverr has two sets of customers - the ones who buy the products, and the ones who pay the seller fees. We’re customers of Fiverr too, just a different type. It’s a cliche, but it’s true; without sellers there would be no Fiverr.
And for all the enormous improvements that buyers have seen in the way they interact with the Fiverr platform over the years, I feel that we as sellers haven’t seen quite the same level of improvements.
I’m hopeful that will change, and I’m excited about the Promoted Gigs feature that’s hopefully launching soon. It would make sense to bundle some new metrics in with that, so who knows?

reply_text:
jobtheilstrator:
Then why is that so many people complaining about it?Please stop saying it is not a problem…
People are complaining because they think the analytics display issue is related to a gigs activity in the search results and this is not true. Fiverr has said exactly this.
Those who are complaining merely because they cannot see their analytics (which are still being calculated, just not shown), have a valid complaint. Those who are complaining that they think their gigs are failing because of the analytics display issue, are merely wasting time. The two things are not related. By Fiverr’s own statement, the analytics display issue has nothing to do with gigs in the search system. I will continue to remind people that there is no search results problem, until Fiverr specifically says otherwise. I am expressing the truth, as we know it. It is not your place to demand that I do otherwise.

reply_text:
celebrawitch:
My point is that my sales have been really good since I started my fiverr account and they dropped at the same time Fiverr stopped showing gig impressions. Obviously I am going to think there is a correlation and so will others who are having that same issue.
And, obviously, based upon what Fiverr has said, that would be a wrong assumption.
celebrawitch:
If you aren’t having any problems and doing so well with your business, why do you have so much time to spend on the forums when the problem doesn’t even concern you?
I choose to be here, and I choose to dedicate some of my time each day to help others. I also stand against misinformation – as I have, on the forum, for years. Just because I am successful with my sales, does not mean I should stop interacting here. My continued hope is that there are people who ARE willing to listen to reason, wisdom, and my expert advice… and those who listen can become as successful as I, and other veteran sellers, have become.
In fact, over the years, many sellers have thanked me for sharing my advice and insight here on the forums. I am honored to have been a part of the success many other former new sellers are now experiencing. If YOU don’t want to listen, that’s fine… clearly you don’t want to be helped right now.
celebrawitch:
Perhaps you shouldn’t give unsolicited advice when you don’t even know someone’s situation.
That’s the thing, though, in large part, I DO know the situations of most who are complaining. I’ve been here for years, and I have seen just about everything. I have also experienced what the loud voices are complaining about, and I have learned from those experience. It would be wonderful it those who are complaining about things that aren’t even true, would stop and look at the situation objectively, and realize that what they are doing is expending needless energy that could be better invested in becoming better sellers.
celebrawitch:
I did not need your patronizing reply.
And I, respectfully, don’t need you to be telling me not to stand up for reason, and voice an alternate perspective of things. This is a discussion forum… a civil discourse. If you want to believe what isn’t true, that’s fine, but it is not appropriate for you to say that I cannot oppose that misinformation.
I’m here to help those who are willing to listen.

reply_text:
Hi guys, I’m really sad of what’s happening right now and I am affected by this as well its been 3 months of my gig improving then suddenly it went down to 0 impressions on april 28 and I get no messages or orders after this bug, but we can stop arguing about this, I’ve asked one my top rated seller friend, he’s been on fiverr since 2012. I’ve asked him if its a natural rotation or really a bug, because the rotation happened at the same time the gig analytics went offline. I’m still in doubt but I trust my friend about this, he said there’s a time that our gig will be on the last page for maybe a month, but it’ll go back as it is, and fiverr will give you a chance to shine again. I hope this comment will help ease my fellow freelancers. and I hope we can get back to the track as soon as possible. Cheers to us! and Godbless to us all.
P.S FOR THOSE WHO WANTS TO HELP, HELP BY MAKING OUR FELLOW FREELANCERS FEEL AT EASE, NOT MAKE IT WORSE BY SAYING THEY’RE BAD IN ADVERTISING/PROMOTING!

thread_text:
We are currently experiencing a problem preventing you from seeing your Gigs’ impressions, clicks, and views. But not to worry, your Gigs are active. Fiverr’s Dev team is aware of the bug and is working on a resolution. Thank you for your patience.
You can share your experience or post an update on this in this thread.
Edit on :
June 2, 2020 (Dhaka)
We already have 500+ replies regarding this issue, Fiverr Dev Team working on it to fix. Unless Fiverr fixes the issue, there isn’t anything we can do. For now, the thread is closed for any new reply, For detailed information please read the entire thread, a lot of information/experience already shared here.
Edit: The issue is resolved.
If you still do not see the fix, please log out, try clearing cookies, and logging back in. If that still doesn’t work, please contact support with your information.
~ Read This.
reply_text:
ianamoncio:
P.S FOR THOSE WHO WANTS TO HELP, HELP BY MAKING OUR FELLOW FREELANCERS FEEL AT EASE, NOT MAKE IT WORSE
Those who do not wish to accept facts/truth/how Fiverr works, are not likely to feel at ease. Let’s all just be patient, and let Fiverr fix the display error when they are able to fix it. None of us need the displayed statistics in order to connect to our target markets, and convince those customers to hire us.
Knowing how many impressions a gig has on this site, will not guarantee a more successful gig. That’s not how Fiverr works. Stats are merely informational data. Actions = profit.

reply_text:
marthacontents:
I have seen a gig with 1star review on the first page of a niche in Fiverr. First page with 1 star review and 1 order for weeks.
I have noticed a lot of new gigs on the first page now too. It’s impossible to figure out how gigs are rotated.
Clearly there is much more than gig analytics determining where gigs are placed. Because those gigs must have terrible analytics aside from massive impressions which who knows why they deserve that.
I’ve seen new gigs without orders which never get orders stay on the first page month after month for no reason I could see, then later the person became a top rated seller, so there are things which fiverr likes about a gig that have nothing to do with how many orders it gets, or how new it is.

reply_text:
I track the stats for the month after I’ve made changes to my gig, including sales. Increased stats tend to lead to increased sales, decreased stats tend to lead to decreased sales, obviously. While sales are the best metric, my gig is rather niche, so I don’t get them all that often; that being the case, the stats are a quicker metric of interest in my gig and allow me to fine tune prices and packages more rapidly.
More impressions = more interest = more sales.

reply_text:
I entered your title of your first gig into the search bar. Here are a few observations of the gigs on the first page:
Only 3 are level 2 sellers
Only 5 are level 1 sellers
6 are Pro sellers
the rest are level 0 sellers – that’s 31 sellers are level 0 on the first page
On the second page, 35 are level 0 sellers
There are 12,868 level 0 sellers and only about 4,200 level 1 and 2 combined.
So there are an overwhelming number of new sellers or level 0 sellers compared to the rest. If anyone’s gig comes up on the first or second page they have truly won the lottery.

reply_text:
I’m new to the Forum and created my first gig a few months ago. There are a lot of opinions about what is going on, so rather than sharing my opinion I’ll share my experience.
I originally saw my impressions drop to 0 randomly after having climbed up to around 90 a day beginning around the 28th of April.
I have had my most productive month-long period so far from halfway through April to about a week ago, with 27 orders overall and around 13 inquiries per day. I was getting so many orders that I marked myself as “out of office” for the better part of a week and a half to slow down. When I came back, my first day began with about 4 new inquiries and nothing else. Since then, I have received absolutely nothing, no messages or orders from new buyers (I’ve had two messages from returning buyers but no orders).
That is my experience. I’ve found my gig on the very last page of search results for about a week, so it’s searchable, but almost impossible to find.
As for my opinion, I want to believe it’s the system glitching but I’m just not sure. I heard there was a gig rotation around the same time so it might just be that. Nevertheless, I feel like an international company should be able to have fixed this glitch within a few days, let alone a month. Being new to Fiverr, I’m really not in much of a position to criticize, but I really hope this is a fluke and not how Fiverr normally operates, keeping us all in the dark like this.
If anyone more experienced has info on how Fiverr normally works it would be much appreciated! Have a great day/night everyone

tommybmedia:
I have had my most productive month-long period so far from halfway through April to about a week ago, with 27 orders overall and around 13 inquiries per day. I was getting so many orders that I marked myself as “out of office” for the better part of a week and a half to slow down. When I came back, my first day began with about 4 new inquiries and nothing else. Since then, I have received absolutely nothing,
Hello, you may have shot yourself in the foot by going out of office for a week and a half. I’m just guessing but that can sometimes lead to a slowdown in orders when you come back.
You also mentioned April 28 which seems to be about the time others report a slowdown. So it’s not possible to tell what happened in any particular case.
My theory is that there has been such an influx of new sellers that things are being adjusted to account for that.
If you check the number of sellers in any category now you will probably see a staggering amount of new sellers.
It’s a highly competitive site now. What the secret is to getting more impressions and visibility no one knows.

reply_text:
Hi Fiverr Team,
I am a bit confused by how you handle this issue. As you can imagine, displaying gig statistics is quite an important functionality for any fiverr seller on your platform. You even promote it as one of the basic functionalities of fiverr in your eLearning videos. And this is sure true as interpreting and reacting to gigs analytics data may have direct impact on the received orders.
Mistakes can happen and problems pop up every now and then in any company but I am left rather speechless how you handle this incident.
First, there is no transparent communication on this issue beside this orange box, which is telling the obvious, i.e. that the gigs statistics are not displayed and that you are working on it. But common, you have a blog, why not use it to communicate with your customers? Why are the gigs stats down? Have you been hacked? Did someone press delete accidentally? Did a server go down? How is the progress of fixing the issue so far? Anything?!
Instead people have to search through the forums for a thread, which is not even marked sticky, but people actually have to search for it. On top, the thread basically says the same as the orange box and is flooded by repeating questions of your customers. This is a pretty bad communication Fiverr team.
Moreover, asking in the forums, I was merely pointed to this thread, which doesn’t provide any information at all, instead of answering my questions, which are rather legit to most of us. On top, without having a chance to reply my thread was closed? Pretty strange way of addressing legit requests of your customers.
I hope you can use this current challenge to heavily improve the way you communicate incidents with your customers.
Happy to receive your feedback.
Cheers,
André

@andreschaller That’s a nice note. Well written. However, it seems to me thinking as if I were part of the management team on fiverr, that it’s not a good idea to share secrets or the internal workings of what is always going on. Fiverr is a publicly held company. How the site is run is a subject that is not to be made public. Internal decisions on any changes to the site are not going to be announced.
We sellers have to work with the changes that come along and do the best we can.
As far as I know, the fiverr team does not read posts here most of the time.
What if those stats are being eliminated? What if they are being changed in a big way? They can’t tell us in advance. They have a large company on the stock exchange here. Any sort of advance announcements like that could affect stock shares, either good or bad.

Hi @misscrystal,
thanks! Actually, it is not about sharing secrets at all. it is about communication. Incident response and incident response communication are standard processes of any company. It is not a binary decision to either publicly disclose non-secret data or not disclose anything because internal processes might be affected. In both cases, transparent communication is key.
I am not saying that the public should decide how the side is run. It is really just about communicating issues that affect the platform as a whole to its customers. I think this is a basic process for any company like mentioned above.
Best,
André

I’m just waiting for this to be resolved AND for peoples gig visibility to still be down. I’m taking a stab in the dark here that the two things (metrics not showing AND search visibility down) are actually two separate incidents.

In terms of the search visibility I think that they’ve probably made their search algorithm a little too harsh on some ranking factors hence why peoples searches are down. Although this isn’t Google (which has over 200 separate ranking factors) it still is a search engine and needs to be twaked periodically.
Judging by the influx of questions regarding this I feel it needs to be tweaked again.
As for my gigs visibility? It seems that my orders are fluctuating between getting a big fat 0 per day to up to 10 per day.
Go figure.

reply_text:
Thanks for further looking into the situation. I’m in complete agreeance with you. As a Level 2 Seller with 200+ reviews on this specific gig alone, it doesn’t seem logical (or fair but we won’t go into that) that “randomly” my Best Selling gig would lose it’s search authority to instead preference gigs with limited credibility.
I read one post that possibly they’ve skewed the algorithm to favor new Sellers amidst the COVID-19 crisis? While in a way I understand the logic, I too spent nearly a year putting my blood, sweat and tears into creating something sustainable out of this gig - proving my capabilities, commitment to customer service, etc.
If this is an intentional shift in the algorithm, it is disappointing that Fiverr would do wrong by loyal Sellers, who too are struggling through this humanitarian and economic crisis. May I ask if this is an issue you might recommend inquiring further with customer service about? I’ve tried politely, but receive a blanket response re: display issue. Thanks again for your time.

reply_text:
I feel I need to share something positive in this bad mood topic.
I don't know what's happening, but I like it
Your Fiverr Experience
I am a 15 year old web developer, I started my Fiverr account in March and I got my first order 1 week later. Until May I got an order every ~2 weeks, which was still good for me. But this month something happened. My orders skyrocketed. I get at least 4 messages a day. Most of them buy my gig and I’ve been able to raise my prices. In May until now I earned about 200$. It’s become quite overwhelming and I had to pause my gigs until I get the current active orders done. All in all, I’m very glad …

reply_text:
Thanks so much for the compliment!
Honestly, I rarely change it, and I know that causes me to drop back in rankings. When I do though, it’s important for me to see how that affects changes in the long run as, like I said, my gig is niche. I understood that going in. The only thing I can use to evaluate the interest (note that I’m not saying success) is in analytics, as my sales aren’t frequent enough to give good data.
I wonder if this whole argument is just the difference in perspectives. For those who have a steady stream of sales, the analytics page is essentially useless. You know sales are going to come in and your gig is running like a well-oiled machine; what’s the point of checking impressions, then?
For those who don’t expect many sales (like me), the analytics data actually serve a role as they’re an important indicator of interest. I only get a few sales a month, which I’m fine with, so I need to rely on other indicators for gig performance. They’re not perfect, but it generally helps me predict if a sale is coming or if my ads on other sites are actually driving traffic to my gig.
Of course, there are plenty of new recruits who are using analytics as a source of hope, and that’s where a lot of problems come up, as they’re not entirely reliable and don’t guarantee anything.

reply_text:
markadamsdesign:
For those who have a steady stream of sales, the analytics page is essentially useless. You know sales are going to come in and your gig is running like a well-oiled machine; what’s the point of checking impressions, then?
I totally agree with this. When my gig was getting almost around 2-3 orders a day, I didn’t give my analytics any attention. However, now I haven’t gotten any orders in the past 2 weeks and it would be incredibly useful to see if there was a drop in impressions or the same amount of impressions, just nobody is inquiring (which I could use to adjust my gig accordingly.)
This bug is getting really annoying and I just wish Fiverr would say anything, even if it was just a 5 word update like “We’re still alive and working!” But we’re just getting silence.

reply_text:
tommybmedia:
I haven’t gotten any orders in the past 2 weeks and it would be incredibly useful to see if there was a drop in impressions or the same amount of impressions, just nobody is inquiring (which I could use to adjust my gig accordingly.)
I would hazard a guess that your impressions have gone way down if you stopped getting orders, if you regularly got orders before.
I can tell where my gig is located approximately and how many impressions it gets by how many messages and orders I get.
Impressions are not the whole story since you can get a lot of very low quality impressions, where your gig is actually being displayed, but not in a place anyone is looking for it to buy it.
It’s always possible that you can have lots of impressions without any sales if your gig is shown only to a certain demographic, certain country, certain out of the way place, where it is assured it won’t get sales.
We all would like our gigs to be shown mostly in one or two countries known to represent the most buyers but it’s possible to have it displayed where no one ever wants it also. Fiverr is good at showing impressions where it’s not going to get many sales sometimes as part of it’s rotation.
Fiverr can also slow down sales for you in spite of a lot of impressions by putting the gigs of your competition right on your own gig page.

reply_text:
That was most likely your 60 day average rating. If you hadn’t had any ratings in the last 60 days it would have no ratings to base that 60 day average on so would show “N/A”. After you had a new rating it would base it on that rating and show that as the average, which is why it now shows something there.
Fiverr hasn’t changed anything there. It’s not related to the “N/A” showing in the gig stats for everyone.

Because you are doing well thats why you dont need to check your gig stats
I never checked my gig stats them when I was a newbie, either.

reply_text:
You took the words right out of my mouth. With these replies, I could swear that there are 2-3 people getting paid to calm people down because of the panic this bug is creating.
As I said earlier, the gigs stopped rotating and you might be lucky to be on the first or second page when it stopped. However, there are people stuck on the last page.
I receive atleast two messages on Fiverr everyday and ever since this bug started, I have received 0. 0. I have like 5 friends on Fiverr that the same has happened to. Either their gigs disappeared to the last page or they can’t even find their gigs anymore. On the other hand , you will find gigs with 1 star reviews , 2 star reviews on the first page. And these gigs have been on the first page for weeks now. That would never happen if everything was normal.
Yes you’re lucky, your gigs are working fine because the platform collapsed when you were on the first page or so, but you can’t use your own privileges to downplay what everyone else is going through. That makes no sense at all.
As it has been said repeatedly here, if it was a just a display issue, Fiverr would have solved it in a day. IT IS WAY MORE THAN THAT. The N/A bug has messed up the algorithm but Fiverr won’t tell us that because that will make them lose people.
Waking up to see replies dismissing everyone’s claims as “illogical” or just replying with “Fiverr has already said it doesn’t affect so it doesn’t ” make me sick.

reply_text:
My gig used to receive 3-4 orders with 80-100 views everyday, a few months back Fiverr even contacted me to help them with creating a whole new category since I was and still am one of the top sellers within the Tattoo Design category.
Ever since the gig analytics crashed I have had a maximum of 4 clicks on my gig per day and I have gotten an eighth of the orders that I usually get.
I understand that this is not a large amount of people and I am not asking for any type of special treatment. I would just like to add to the obvious evidence that can be found in the forum already.
I have worked extremely hard to gain momentum on this platform, just like many other sellers here that are experiencing the same problem. The customer support service needs to address this problem and give their sellers the respect that they deserve.

Don’t get me wrong. but analytics is not working. One thing is that we can see the numbers and graphics there. A completely different thing is that it is fixed.
The numbers and graphic I got there are just completely unrealistic. For new gigs where I was having pretty much zero or one view per day, now in the last weeks I have had in between 20 and 30 views, of course with no orders or messages.
And for my top gigs with around 30 views per day, now it seems I was having around 150 views, but I have actually had like 10 times less orders than before.
THIS IS JUST NOT FIXED.

thread_name: Request for add Messages seen option
frequent_posters: himel19, infenixx, merinakanda, catwriter, nikavoice, hmmirazulislam, magicprincebgb, jonbaas
thread_text:
Hi everyone,
Sometime we send message to Byers, but we don’t get reply for long time,
And there is no way to know is he/she seen message or not.
Same goes for Byers.
I think if fiverr add this functionality in message option that’s will so helpful for everyone.
Thanks to all
reply_text: yes. right point …

thread_name: Request for add Messages seen option
frequent_posters: himel19, infenixx, merinakanda, catwriter, nikavoice, hmmirazulislam, magicprincebgb, jonbaas
thread_text:
Hi everyone,
Sometime we send message to Byers, but we don’t get reply for long time,
And there is no way to know is he/she seen message or not.
Same goes for Byers.
I think if fiverr add this functionality in message option that’s will so helpful for everyone.
Thanks to all
reply_text:
How would it help? Buyers will either reply to you, or not; knowing whether they’ve seen your message won’t change that.
Also, what if you see a message, but can’t respond to it quickly, and the buyer is impatient? Do you want them to get angry at you because they know you saw the message?

thread_name: Request for add Messages seen option
frequent_posters: himel19, infenixx, merinakanda, catwriter, nikavoice, hmmirazulislam, magicprincebgb, jonbaas

I think if fiverr add this functionality in message option that’s will so helpful for everyone.
Thanks to all
reply_text:
You got exact point,
buyer or seller will benefited by this,
Because we will able to know is he/she declining messages or not seen yet.
Also it’s help us to be patience until my buyer or seller Shaw messages,
and I haven’t send one after.

thread_name: Request for add Messages seen option
frequent_posters: himel19, infenixx, merinakanda, catwriter, nikavoice, hmmirazulislam, magicprincebgb, jonbaas
thread_text:
Hi everyone,
Sometime we send message to Byers, but we don’t get reply for long time,
And there is no way to know is he/she seen message or not.
Same goes for Byers.
I think if fiverr add this functionality in message option that’s will so helpful for everyone.
Thanks to all
reply_text:
himel19:
Because we will able to know is he/she declining messages or not seen yet.
Fiverr is not set up for sellers to “decline messages” that they don’t want to respond to. In fact, quite the opposite – sellers have 24 hours to respond to any messages that they receive, before not responding starts to penalize their response stat.
Be patient. People will respond to messages as soon as they are able.

thread_name: “Ranked sellers trouble” - we all on the bottom at search result. No orders - no money?
frequent_posters: vadikne, vickiespencer, hrizvi2000, rashad91, naimadesign, jymsym, humanissocial, richardfmendes, frank_d, praveenyt150
thread_text:
I noticed that from August 1, 2020, the flow of questions and orders from new customers has stopped.
Absolutely.
Instead of 5-6 new customers every day there is just zero now.
I looked for my gigs and found them all at the very bottom of the search results.
Five star Gig with hundreds of reviews lies below absolute beginners and low-rated gigs.
From first line to last page for one day!
Besides myself, I saw on the last page of all my fellow competitors of the 2nd level.
How do you like that, friends?
Support politely advised to read the forum.
P.S. If we don’t make any income this month, how will Fiverr itself make money?
This is the first time I’ve seen this in 2 years.
Who what thinks about this?
It will be black August…
reply_text:
The situation you are speaking of is normal on Fiverr. Your placement is all part of the secret Fiverr algorithm. I was getting several orders per day, and now I too am going through a dry spell due to my gigs’ placement.
There are only 48 first page positions for gigs, and not all of the gigs on Fiverr can appear there. Fiverr also boosts new sellers by letting them appear on the first pages for a short time.
There is not much you can do about the situation. I use the time to improve my gigs and relax, knowing my time to be in a better search placement will return.
vadikne:
P.S. If we don’t make any income this month, how will Fiverr itself make money?
Fiverr is not dependent on each of us as sellers as there are tens of thousands of sellers on Fiverr.

reply_text:
hrizvi2000:
Looking at market place its clearly apparent to me.
I have noticed that too.
hrizvi2000:
Does buyers want to buy gig from new sellers especially with fake reviews? Thats the real question.
I think most buyers are knowledgeable enough to figure out if reviews are fake. I am a seller and a buyer on Fiverr. I read not only the reviews of the seller, but I look at the buyer’s profile. If the buyer has reviews from the seller, then I know the reviews are more than likely fake.
Also, many buyers and sellers with questionable accounts and claim to be US citizens will soon be losing their accounts due to Fiverr’s new requirement that they prove they are US citizens by submitting a W9 tax form with their Social Security number on it. Good riddance to such fake accounts and their fake reviews.

thread_name: “Ranked sellers trouble” - we all on the bottom at search result. No orders - no money?
frequent_posters: vadikne, vickiespencer, hrizvi2000, rashad91, naimadesign, jymsym, humanissocial, richardfmendes, frank_d, praveenyt150
thread_text:
I noticed that from August 1, 2020, the flow of questions and orders from new customers has stopped.
Absolutely.
Instead of 5-6 new customers every day there is just zero now.
I looked for my gigs and found them all at the very bottom of the search results.
Five star Gig with hundreds of reviews lies below absolute beginners and low-rated gigs.
From first line to last page for one day!
Besides myself, I saw on the last page of all my fellow competitors of the 2nd level.
How do you like that, friends?
Support politely advised to read the forum.
P.S. If we don’t make any income this month, how will Fiverr itself make money?
This is the first time I’ve seen this in 2 years.
Who what thinks about this?
It will be black August…
reply_text:
hrizvi2000:
I think fiverr algo boosts gigs with recent reviews.
If that were the case I wouldn’t also be facing a slump in sales.
Public reviews are not as “important” factors to the algorithm anymore.
They used to be, but not anymore.
Aside from negative reviews, anything over 3.0 stars is pretty much useless to the algo.
The number of sellers sporting a 4.9+ average nowadays is insane.
So the algorithm has been adjusted.
Did you know that it’s partly why the “secret reviews” were introduced?
Those are much more important to how you rank.

Who what thinks about this?
It will be black August…
reply_text:
Unfortunately, Fiverr’s algo does seem to try and spread the love so that people who are beginners or level 1 get a bite of the cherry. I suppose it’s their way of getting the cream to float to the top. Because what, in theory, should be happening is that we get lots of regular customers which means we’re not so dependent on the search results.
However, I know I’ve been through fallow periods too. At first I panicked, and changed lots of things in my gig - profile description, gig description, tags. You name it and I definitely changed it. I had a very slack period before Christmas - horrible - and I had to tighten my belt. Then things changed and got better in January. So, what I’d say is that just tickle your gigs, maybe polish them a bit, get your friendly local proofreader (me) to check them for you and make sure your images are professional and your tags are likely to work. Then wait…

Focus on creating a sustainable business instead of relying on ranking well in a subcategory and then being mad at Fiverr when you don’t get that.
No successful business relies on factors it can’t control. What research have you done on your competition here?

Known issues with the Skill Tests provided by ExpertRating
Fiverr Site Suggestions

If you’ve explored the options on your profile, you may have found the Skill Tests. These currently have no active benefit to Sellers unless a Buyer specifically looks for them. thread_name: Constant emails “Are You Trying To Log In From a New Device?”
thread_text: Every single time when I login on Fiverr, I immediately get an email asking “Are You Trying To Log In From a New Device?”, even though I always log in from the same computer, from the same spot and in the same network. Like with most providers, mine doesn’t give out fixed IP addresses to private users, but that’s normal for most people working from home. It’s really annoying and I clearly see it as a bug. Unfortunately, when I tried to contact Fiverr to report that bug via their support site, I can only choose options that are not even close to this problem. Has anybody had the same problem? How did you fix it? Why is Fiverr not fixing it?
reply_text:
Welcome to the Fiverr forums.
Have you checked your profile settings? Do you permit cookies? Permit location?

reply_text:
Welcome to the Fiverr forums.
This is a known bug.
Known issues with the Skill Tests provided by ExpertRating
Fiverr Site Suggestions
New bug: title of test missing from display. [image] There have also been reports lately of required tests, taken and passed, that are still stated as ‘need to take’ within a gig itself. (Try clearing cookies/cache, try a different browser, try waiting 24-48 hours, and if the problem persists contact Customer Support.)

reply_text:
I’m not sure how specific can I be, my head is on fire right now. But:
I get 2* on Jun 2. My first negative review. (I have an old 1* but tend not to count it because it’s for that order auto-completing). It’s a funny story for another time. The order is Fiverr’s Choice.
On Jun 3 I receive 2 orders back to back from new people of my other gig that no one ever buys. It’s very interesting because I haven’t gotten multiple orders from new people on the same day ever since Covid happened.
I complete those, get 5* for both. My main gig is dead.
On Jun 4 the buyer who left me a negative review comes to my inbox and tries to force me to remove the response I’ve left to their review. I report the threat and contact CS. CS tells me there is no case, he had a right to leave a review, I had a right to respond.
On Jun 5 I get another Fiverr’s Choice order on my main gig, finish that one with 5*. The person buys another 3 designs as a custom package. This new custom offer is also marked as Fiverr’s choice. I complete it with 5*.
It’s been a deluge ever since. I got to my entire May earnings around June 12th.
I should mention that my regulars start coming back in June and they mostly order bigger custom packages. Well, bigger for me. My basic price is $50. They mostly buy $150-200 custom offers.
I also get a few new returning customers. We start with a basic package, they later come back to get another 3-4. If that has anything to do with, well, anything.
My delivery time was 3 days during quarantine, I had to switch it back to 4 days in June. Doesn’t seem to affect anything. I usually deliver 12-24 hours before the deadline.
May was terrible. I hit my “comfortable minimum” but barely. Had a few unpleasant interactions with buyers. I worked for that “comfortable minimum” hard.
No cancellations since Apr 1. Then I had the same custom offer canceled twice because the buyer couldn’t sort out their payment method. It led to $700 of canceled funds (my absolute record) handing over my head till Jun 1. CS assured me it wouldn’t affect anything but who knows.

The only way this pay per click on fiverr will work is if it really does work well for sellers, who gain substantial profits from it, so they need to tailor the placements of gigs using it for maximum exposure.
This would be a huge change requiring careful testing, so it makes sense to me to shut down all analytics data while this is going on. I can understand that. I could also understand if the arrangements of gigs in the rankings is temporarily affected by such a test.
It would involve changing how the algorithm is working.
My guess is that it’s only affecting certain categories.

reply_text:
My feeling is that Fiverr’s approach was to attempt to just slip the extra layer (paid ads) into the existing algorithm … resulting in the whole thing falling apart.
Add that to the tsunami of new sellers … major nightmare, from their point of view.
If that’s so, they’re having to write the thing from scratch, test it, roll back to a previous version … rinse, repeat …
And that’s why we don’t see the impressions etc - they’re changing the active algorithm too often for any of that to make any sense at all …

reply_text:
coerdelion:
My feeling is that Fiverr’s approach was to attempt to just slip the extra layer (paid ads) into the existing algorithm … resulting in the whole thing falling apart.
I think they have always hand selected the top two rows at least, or been able to insert a few into those rows by hand instead of by algorithm.
I don’t think it fell apart. I think they may have altered it or changed what parameters it favors among gigs.
I think it was set to artificially boost some gigs and hold down other gigs that could have actually done better if things were left to rank gigs organically, so sellers could get orders even if they were less deserving for various reasons.
I think they took that set of parameters off in the last two months.
And by doing this, they can see what gigs are actually performing the best and which perform the worst, without any type of manipulations.

reply_text:
Hi Frank
It is very important to look at the views, because generally when I was already finishing the work with the active orders I typically saw that Fiverr increased the impressions of my most successful Gigs.
When the up arrows indicated that views were increasing, customers would start writing to you. (this has been going on for 5 years).
Am i paranoid I like conspiracy theories?
It’s possible…
Maybe the problem is that I spend 15 years of my life developing applications for the cloud computing. (I’m system engineer)
One of the basic things according to ITIL best practices is the attention to breakdowns.
When a change is made in an active platform with millions of users there is always a plan to return in case it fails, there are data backups, there is always a contingency plan.
It is impossible that something as expensive as Fiverr has 1 month down.
Sorry but beleive , What happens here is NOT a bug.
Something they are trying, it is probably the promotions (but I do not know).
They may have decided that people who don’t pay won’t get any promotions. Maybe they stop charging us 20% and return our money in less time. Maybe things changed. Maybe they are testing our reaction.
It is also possible that they have decided to change the entire model and they do not care what we think.
In a pandemic, confined, many people looking for money and supplies in many countries and Fiverr “fallen”?
They have to explain something to us …

tech_treon:
Please can you explain me a bit about fiverr’s choice, I mean are sellers selected for it or gigs? and when someone places an order, does fiverr see that this order is a bit interesting and mark the order as fiverr’s choice before you delivering it or it works the other way?
Hi, I know didn’t ask me, but I think no one answered. Fiverr’s Choice is given to the gig, not the seller. Some people believe it’s manually chosen, but I think it’s the algorithm and it has to do with maintaining 5 stars and probably has a lot to do with the secret reviews as well.
I’ve been Fiverr’s Choice almost continuously since March but only a few of my orders say they are “Fiverr’s Choice orders”. I think it’s because the badge doesn’t show with every keyword, so the ones that say they are, it just means that particular buyer chose me after seeing the badge.
But this is just a theory, because once I asked CS and they talked about something else…

It is very difficult to know if Fiverr is doing its job of exposing our Gigs because there is no way to see the numbers.
I have seen in this forum people who assure that we should lower prices and make special offers to receive offers from new clients, however
I want to know if anyone knows what is happening in Fiverr?
When are you planning to solve the problem?
I am one of those who Fiverr is an important income and suddenly everything has stopped.
Is the same happening to you?
Are you receiving orders and messages as always?

reply_text:
carlosrada1:
It is very difficult to know if Fiverr is doing its job of exposing our Gigs because there is no way to see the numbers.
First of all, this is NOT Fiverr’s job.
Fiverr is nothing but a marketplace, and the amount of work you get is by far most influenced by supply and demand. If you do a good job, and your clients are happy, you move up in the world and get more orders. There are different other factors, for example, if you are doing this full time or just as a side thing, also it is important to be online, as many customers want a fast/instant reply, etc.
The gig stat “issue” has no relevance, it is just metrics that they show you.
Personally I am getting the same number of daily requests I have always had.
I see that you are musician, as such I am sure you are very well aware of the impact COVID19 has had on the music industry, it is simply not something essential for most companies, and if no money is coming in it will quickly go very far down on the companies list of priorities.
I am sure things will start looking up for you soon.
I wish you good luck and all the best!

reply_text:
patrickcharlie:
First of all, this is NOT Fiverr’s job.
Hi Patrick, Thanks for write! COngratulations you are the second person who have no problem at all here, of course I know this post is too long now. So , it’s difficult to read…
Patrick lot off sellers on Fiverr have been experiencing a blackout.
During the entire pandemic I was full of work here. Suddenly everything stopped. No messages, no orders and I left the search lists.
The first thing I thought was that it was my problem! Quickly searching the forum I understood that it was not just me, there were other sellers with the problem.
What happens to the vast majority?
Having the best possible level, fulfilling everything on time and with 5-star evaluations took us out of the game.
Patrick, there are people here who have written indicating that they are Top Rated, they received 50 orders on average and today they have nothing.
Friend something is wrong with Fiverr.
It is evident that if I am 5 years old in this I already understood what I must do to go up in the lists, but the case of the Top Rated who have large incomes is even clearer that this sudden blackout is not normal.
Fiverr is making changes to its platform to introduce a new scheme with paid ads. Many say the forum that they have decided to “move” things especially with classic vendors that have Gigs for years producing…
This new method with ads is already in the testing stage for very few users. That’s not the problem!! The problem is that most of us were removed from the search lists.
patrickcharlie:
Fiverr is nothing but a marketplace, and the amount of work you get is by far most influenced by supply and demand.
In this you are right! Let me explain now how that “supply - demand” works on Fiverr.
A buyer searches Fiverr for a service.
Fiverr shows him a list of sellers. That has been changing over the years. Now Fiverr Pro users appear at the top (which makes total sense) and then users with rankings appear and the list turns pages to leave those less relevant at the end.
Fiverr exposes your Gig to its community, for this reason it takes away 20% of your income and also retains your money for 14 days.
That is Fiverr’s job. and they must show you that they are exposing you in exchange for that 20%, that you will receive if you have done things well and on time.
Of course it is supply and demand, but Fiverr by exposing you is telling buyers “Look at the work of this seller” “It is reliable” “It is fast” “Hundreds of users have made positive reviews”
The relation “Supply - demand” is not magic, Fiverr shows the work and the buyers choose.
That has now lost its meaning! Just read yourself to great sellers here who are experiencing the same so that you understand what you may face …
Thank you for your words and I hope that everything continues well.
Fiverr is a platform and we are understanding as a community what happens here? As soon as we understand it, maybe we can adapt or maybe not!
I also hope that Fiverr returns to be a great platform. Only they have that business model maybe they are changing it

reply_text:
I would not advertise as being “the cheapest”, that is never a good idea when selling services (for physical products there is a difference). Personally when I doubled my prices at one point within 2 months I have had more orders than before, and made a lot more revenue, the cheaper you are the worse your clients get, you get resellers, you get guys who will complain no matter how good you are, because they want a discount, etc.
Also a message to all people who are facing issues, how is your industry doing outside of fiverr? That is something you should keep track of, COVID did not impact all industries the same and not all of them at the same time, some industries are yet to feel the aftermath of COVID, some were hit in the beginning and so on.
So make sure, that you on your side have done absolutely EVERYTHING you can before jumping to conclusions.
I noticed many sellers have some idea about what is important in their industry, but they simply do not know how business in general works - and that is perfectly fine, just find someone to help you out, to coach you, train you or simply consult you.
Best of luck and lots of success to all of you guys, keep your heads up!

That is how you get tricked in to undermining yourself, your colleagues and the industry.
If you work professionally, and if you are really good at what you do, the price is a secondary thing. I am one of the most expensive translators for my language pair, I charge 20x more than the cheapest guy in my category. YOU need to value your work. As I said before when you are too cheap you attract these clients that will ask for even lower prices.

I’ve had long term clients who shop around and tell me that sellers immediately come way down on their prices as an attempt to get them to make a purchase.
And their prices aren’t high to begin with, such as $25 and they come down to $10 without even waiting to see if the person would purchase it for $25. Sellers are entitled to do whatever they want price-wise. But it’s not the best way to establish yourself as a professional.

thread_text:
I have been on Fiverr for more than 5 years, I am really worried because from the “BUG of GIG views” I have not received any messages or orders.
It is very difficult to know if Fiverr is doing its job of exposing our Gigs because there is no way to see the numbers.
I have seen in this forum people who assure that we should lower prices and make special offers to receive offers from new clients, however
I want to know if anyone knows what is happening in Fiverr?
When are you planning to solve the problem?
I am one of those who Fiverr is an important income and suddenly everything has stopped.
Is the same happening to you?
Are you receiving orders and messages as always?
reply_text:
patrickcharlie:
YOU need to value your work
Great Patrick.!
The main idea here is win - win. I agree 100% with you!
If your service is good, it must have a cost, of course it is a market, but that price war on services is pointless.
Doing a service for 5USD so that you have 4USD that is also subject to approval and they give you 14 days later it does not make sense.
Another problem is if Fiverr offers people such low-cost services, are they really quality?
In my case it became impossible to lower prices further.

reply_text:
sarikaverma007:
reduce my prices
Sarika is good to ask yourself this question. Can you keep those ridiculously low prices going forward? If you offer the customer something for 50 and end up doing it for 10, don’t you think he thought you wanted to steal it?
I have years at Fiverr and the truth is that the best jobs and the best experiences are when the client values your effort and you receive what is fair for your work.
Once I accepted a great job because there were many services ( they were many). In the end I couldn’t finish that job well, since the same person who asked to lower prices, as soon as we started began to behave as if he had paid the higher price. I’m talking about something worth maybe 100 leaving it at 30. It was a terrible experience and when I delivered the disputes began. They asked me for changes that were out of budget. They also asked for things that had settled in again.
I understood that it would never end, and the cancellation led me to lose the level and drop a lot in sales also at that time.
It is better to charge fair because you can spend more than you receive. That makes no sense!

reply_text:
No one said there’s a new “Fiverr policy”.
We are all experiencing pretty much the same thing to a different degree.
We are all assuming what may be happening, but no one knows for sure.
My assumption was that there was a significant change to how the algorithm responds and how fast it moves.
I also theorized that the Covid-19 pandemic definitely acted as an accelerator, with all the new accounts being created and with buyers changing how much they are willing to spend on certain things.
But while we are all in the dark, it’s pretty clear this is not a new policy.
We are experiencing a weird shift in the marketplace and we are exchanging insights and experiences.

reply_text:
nguyenkt08:
I can’t see carlosrada1’s gigs, did his account been deleted?
Hi there!
Thanks for writing here!
Here you have my profile
https://www.fiverr.com/carlosrada?up_rollout=true 3
I’ve been on Fiverr by 5 years, as you can see all my Gig appear to be “active”. Saddly many sellers have the same problem, I think you have it now!
Nobody nows exactly the reason of this wear shift. Some seller have this problem like 2-3 months.
At first we thought it was a BUG because the views are not seen but I think this is the new Fiverr normal.
Other sellers have said in this long post that it is the new “paid advertising” scheme. We understand that a few sellers are testing it and that it will be operational soon.
It is evident that advertising will change the position of the sellers in the search lists, and it is possible that this current situation is the first step towards it.
I sincerely believe that the Fiverr business model will change, this is the only platform that operates in this way. They already included the famous “paid certification courses” and only “paid advertising” was missing for Fiverr to become something very similar to its well-known competition …
I think that those of us who have been working here for years must adapt, some sellers suggest having several different work options on other platforms or increasing the presence of your personal brand to make your customer portfolio.
I will always thank Fiverr for giving me the opportunity to make music for more than 25 countries on 5 continents.
We will be back? I do not know…
Do Fiverr want us back? I do not know too…
Do we have to change to continue? That is for sure, we are all doing it with the pandemic …

frequent_posters: vickiespencer, nafishasan, mridul4567, misscrystal, coerdelion, gina_riley2, heyfellow1, imagination7413
thread_text:
I think many sellers faced cancellation for the following reasons -
Buyer purchased basic package but has requirement of standard or premium package and the buyer isn’t interested to purchase additional gig for completion of his task.
Buyer placed order directly (without any prior contact with the seller) for a task which seller can’t complete
To avoid cancellation Fiverr should introduce the following feature -
A seller will have 2 options for receiving orders.
a) Direct order - customer may place order to the seller without any prior communication
b) Order after approval from seller -
Under this system buyer won’t be able to place any order directly. Instead of “order now” button Fiverr will display a button “Contact seller for further discussion and custom offer”. The buyer will contact the seller and after discussion seller will send a custom offer to the buyer. Buyer will only be able to place order accepting the custom offer. It will work as approval from seller that he/she wants to work with the buyer.
Seller will have the option to choose that he wants to receive order directly for a gig or sell only custom offer.
Many seller wrote in the gig description “Please contact me before ordering” but still there are buyers who ignores it and places orders directly.
I think this small feature will decrease a lot of unwanted cancellation.
reply_text: Yes, will make things better for sellers!

reply_text:
You could have just joined the discussion in Changing the way on receiving orders instead of making a new thread.
It’s against the Community Standards & Forum Rules - 2020 1 to create duplicate threads.
Also, a common 3rd reason for cancellations is a buyer not providing requirements, by entering irrelevant text in requirement boxes.

thread_name: Changing the way on receiving orders
frequent_posters: heyfellow1, imagination7413, nafishasan, benedictrm, joeritan, mariashtelle1
thread_text:
So. I have encountered around a total of 7 times where I had to cancel and it wasn’t my fault. This suggestion will not only improve that but give the ability to sellers on what they want. Let me explain.
Here is how it’s done:
Buyer pays
Buyer submits requirements but order DOES NOT BEGIN
Instead the order goes to a new tab, I’d like to call it “order requests”. The seller would choose if he’d like to take the order or not. ( Like this, any problems where the seller can’t do the job can be avoided, or if the customer ordered the wrong gig)
If seller accepts order, the countdown begins
-If seller declines order, the money goes back to the customer.
I think this would avoid a lot of problems. What do you think? Would love to hear your replies!
reply_text:
While I would love for this to be a thing, it goes against the very foundations of the Fiverr platform. Literally. Fiverr started as a buy-now.
To change this is to change the very premise of Fiverr.
That’s not to say it couldn’t change, but it’s ridiculously improbable.
It’s better, for the time being, for you as a seller to be proactive and take preventive measures to minimize the frequency of unnecessary cancellations.

thread_name: Changing the way on receiving orders
frequent_posters: heyfellow1, imagination7413, nafishasan, benedictrm, joeritan, mariashtelle1
thread_text:
So. I have encountered around a total of 7 times where I had to cancel and it wasn’t my fault. This suggestion will not only improve that but give the ability to sellers on what they want. Let me explain.
Here is how it’s done:
Buyer pays
Buyer submits requirements but order DOES NOT BEGIN
Instead the order goes to a new tab, I’d like to call it “order requests”. The seller would choose if he’d like to take the order or not. ( Like this, any problems where the seller can’t do the job can be avoided, or if the customer ordered the wrong gig)
If seller accepts order, the countdown begins
-If seller declines order, the money goes back to the customer.
I think this would avoid a lot of problems. What do you think? Would love to hear your replies!
reply_text: Whilst I do think its unlikely , I’m tired of having to go to customer support every single time and having extra unneeded stress. Fiverr did start a buy-now platform but freelancing is all about communication and a buy-now platform prohibits communication beforehand. ( In some cases not when the buyer reaches out)

thread_name: Changing the way on receiving orders
frequent_posters: heyfellow1, imagination7413, nafishasan, benedictrm, joeritan, mariashtelle1
thread_text:
So. I have encountered around a total of 7 times where I had to cancel and it wasn’t my fault. This suggestion will not only improve that but give the ability to sellers on what they want. Let me explain.
Here is how it’s done:
Buyer pays
Buyer submits requirements but order DOES NOT BEGIN
Instead the order goes to a new tab, I’d like to call it “order requests”. The seller would choose if he’d like to take the order or not. ( Like this, any problems where the seller can’t do the job can be avoided, or if the customer ordered the wrong gig)
If seller accepts order, the countdown begins
-If seller declines order, the money goes back to the customer.
I think this would avoid a lot of problems. What do you think? Would love to hear your replies!
reply_text:
I just made a comment/idea about this yesterday: What's the best format for asking a buyer for information 10
Like I said, find a way to be proactive.

thread_name: Changing the way on receiving orders
frequent_posters: heyfellow1, imagination7413, nafishasan, benedictrm, joeritan, mariashtelle1
thread_text:
So. I have encountered around a total of 7 times where I had to cancel and it wasn’t my fault. This suggestion will not only improve that but give the ability to sellers on what they want. Let me explain.
Here is how it’s done:
Buyer pays
Buyer submits requirements but order DOES NOT BEGIN
Instead the order goes to a new tab, I’d like to call it “order requests”. The seller would choose if he’d like to take the order or not. ( Like this, any problems where the seller can’t do the job can be avoided, or if the customer ordered the wrong gig)
If seller accepts order, the countdown begins
-If seller declines order, the money goes back to the customer.
I think this would avoid a lot of problems. What do you think? Would love to hear your replies!
reply_text:
I agree with the OP request and have thought that many many times.
The current system may be legacy but things outgrow legacy all the time. We haven’t used horses as transport for so long that Hitching Posts are no longer a thing that anyone could reasonably expect.
Right now the Seller is at a massive disadvantage, esp with more complex projects. With a “For $5 I will send you a plastic spoon” kind of job one would assume that said plastic spoon was in-stock.
Scoring for a film or Mixing a song is far less simple and even assuming everything is sent over properly (which sadly is 95% never), it may just not be a good fit and you are forced to do a job that you know you can’t excel at or lose - cancellation causes a loss even if it is the right thing to do for everyone concerned. A lose-lose situation is the complete opposite of the essence of Capitalism.

reply_text:
In general people don’t read and I am feeling Fiverr is not that pro-active in protecting sellers for “unintelligent” buyers who want to harm your score, or just don’t know what they want. My score fluctuated up and down because of this, although in general everything is 5-stars reviewed, so I personally think there should be an extra step before ordering for the buyer.
A tickbox which says: Are you sure you want to buy this Gig? And then move on. It’s ridiculous that people/fellow designers/gigholders like you need to bleed for mistakes made by others.
A matter of good UX/UI Design in the order flow.
